question:
In context with the state level visit from India to Comoros, consider the following statements:
  1. It is located in the Indian Ocean.
  2. It is a part of the Vanilla Islands group.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Comoros is an island nation located in the Indian Ocean. It is located towards the west of Indian Peninsula. It is located along the eastern coast of Africa, at the northern end of the Mozambique Channel. It consists of 3 major islands and numerous smaller islands. Â Statement 2 is correct: Comoros is a part of the Vanilla Islands group. The group is called so because of their involvement in vanilla cultivation. It is a group of island nations that also includes the Madagascar, Mayotte, Reunion, Mauritius and Seychelles. The group was formed to cooperate and develop themselves as popular tourist destination.
